Name: Rim Territories
Description: The Rim Territories is a proto-state officially presented as a mutual defense and trade pact. In truth, it operates as a loose collective of pirate groups, with each world functioning as a criminal fiefdom under the control of its dominant gang or raiding clan. Governed from the capital world of Pain, the Rim Territories thrives on illicit trade, plunder, and under-the-table alliances, while maintaining a thin veneer of legitimacy to negotiate with other factions. This pragmatic and ruthless structure allows the Rim Territories to survive and even profit amidst the chaos of the Inner Sphere.
ReputationStatements: I don't know why we're even talking, Commander. You and your kind aren't exactly popular with the Rim Territories. Still, we're in need of your talents, and desperate times make for strange allies. Take this contract and prove you can be useful.
Ah, Commander. Even the lowest merc can serve a purpose. Complete this job, and maybe we'll find some respect for you yet—or at least tolerate your presence.

Commander, your skills might just fit the job we have lined up. The Rim Territories sees an opportunity for profit, and we think you'll appreciate the terms of the deal. Consider this a test of mutual benefit.
The Rim Territories have a proposition for you, Commander. You're a respected operator, and we believe this contract will appeal to someone with your reputation for getting results.

Greetings, Commander. The overlords of the Rim Territories have been impressed by your recent exploits. We'd like to offer you this contract in recognition of your effectiveness and potential for cooperation.

Ah, a familiar face! Commander, you've shown loyalty and an unmatched knack for succeeding where others falter. Here's a contract that reflects the trust and respect you've earned with us. Let's keep the plunder flowing.

Commander, you've become something of an honorary pirate to us. You're reliable, ruthless, and profitable—qualities we value highly. We have another task for you that only someone like you can handle. Let's not disappoint.
MissionSuccessStatements: Solid work, Commander! You've earned your pay and the respect of the Rim Territories. We'll be sure to send more lucrative work your way soon.
GoodFaithFailureStatements: Commander, you didn't quite get everything done, but at least you showed some backbone. You'll get partial payment this time, but next time, I expect more.
BadFaithFailureStatements: Pathetic, Commander. You failed the job and wasted our time. If you can't deliver next time, don't bother coming back—we don't have room for failures here in the Rim Territories.
